creator: scato@arrakisplanet.com
text:
Currently you can't make a Priority subclass serializable since the default 
implementation doesn't have a protected void constructor (a public void 
constructor doesn't make sense). Eventhough Priority itself isn't serializable 
(so its field's aren't ever saved/restored), it's ok if the subclass overwrites 
the 'resolveObject' method to ensure the use of the VM's singletons.
